title: Battery Expands Creative Leadership Team with New Hire, Promotion
text:
Battery Expands Creative Leadership Team with New Hire, Promotion Advertisement Comment 
Independent Los Angeles agency Battery expanded its creative leadership team with the arrival of Scott Brown as vice president creative director and the promotion of Raymond Hwang to the same role. 
“I’ve witnessed Scott’s deep commitment to the creative process and to the craft of connecting with people to brands in a way that makes them feel something profound,” Battery CCO Philip Khosid said in a statement. “He’s an extraordinary craftsman. He builds great brands and he’s a perfect addition to Battery. I couldn’t be more proud to have him on board.” 
Brown joins Battery from TBWA\Chiat\Day, where he has spent the past 15 years working with brands including Pepsi, Twitter, Airbnb, Netflix, Southwest Airlines, Visa, Nissan and Infiniti. 
“The second I walked into Battery I knew it was a special place,” Brown said. “There’s a feeling of freedom that’s pervasive in all the work and an immediate comradery that feels like home. It very much feels like my early days at Chiat where I witnessed magic being made on a daily basis.” 
Hwang joined Battery as an integrated creative director and copywriter in January of 2015 and has worked with brands including Lego, Mike’s Hard Lemonade and Mortal Kombat X. He previously spent six years as an integrated creative director with Saatchi & Saatchi Los Angeles, where he worked with brands such as Toyota, Square Enix and Surfrider Foundation, before leaving to join Beats by Dre as a freelance integrated creative director and copywriter in March of 2014. Before Saatchi & Saatchi he spent eight years as a copywriter with TBA\Chiat\Day. 
“It’s exciting to see the Battery family grow,” Hwang said. “Since day one, we’ve made it a point to recognize big ideas and the people that make them happen. I couldn’t be happier about the promotion and the fact that Scott is part of the team. He and I go way back and I’m looking forward to doing big things together.”
